title: Huawei Mate S: 5.5-inch octa-core with 2.5D screen and force touch
text:
News from: Eza Ezamie Page views: 39 times Finally, the Force Touch technology that was made popular by Apple made its way to the Android scene. Huawei Mate S is the first to do so and it will be followed by the rest. - Advertisement - 
Inspired by the power of design and technology to touch lives, the Mate S is all about the latest tech all around. It combines beauty with interactivity and is made to arouse your senses to the maximum. 
Being incredibly thin at just 149.8 x 75.3 x 7.2 mm (5.90 x 2.96 x 0.28 in) makes a difference. Weighing in at just 156 g (5.50 oz), it is lightweight as well. There’s a fingerprint sensor built-in and to further protect your precious investment, the Corning Gorilla Glass 4 comes into the picture. 
The screen part is where the amazing stuff begins. With a 5.5-inch Full HD 1080 x 1920 pixels or ~401 ppi pixel density, you will surely enjoy your time with the phablet. That’s normal compared to what you 
Have you heard about 2.5D screen? The Mate S comes with a contoured glass screen with a seamless border, and that will give an elegant edge to the design and makes swiping gestures much easier with the smartphone. 
The Mate S introduces a new way for you to connect. The next generation of interactive touch, it gives a more personalized touch between yourself to a higher level. There’s Fingerprint 2.0 which comes with Smart Fingerprint Sliding where the fingerprint sensor is being used to control your smartphone. Answer calls, take pictures, control brightness or browse pages without taking your finger off the sensor. Pretty cool right? 
Then we have Knuckle 2.0 which for the first time lets you can use your knuckles to crop and edit images, record screen, and even open applications by drawing a letter on your screen with your knuckle. It will then open up the application instantly, at a high speed that you have never experienced before. 
Next there’s the Force Touch Technology, which was first introduced by Apple. You can now unleash the true power of 3D touch whereby pressing harder will then make it zoom further, preview photos in the gallery or play games better. The possibilities are endless, and the future is limitless, all up to you. Finally, there’s a feature that we don’t normally associate with a smartphone that is to be used to weigh objects; just by placing objects on your phone’s screen. 
Under the hood of the Mate, S is the HiSilicon Kirin 935 chipset, an Octa-core processor comprising Quad-core 2.2 GHz & Quad-core 1.5 GHz, Mali-T628 MP4 graphics and 3GB RAM. This is the top-of-the-line hardware that is only missing an additional 1GB to make it a total of 4GB. But not too worry though, even with 3GB – that is more than enough. There won’t be any apps or games that it can’t run fast enough. - Advertisement - 
In terms of camera, the Mate S is equipped with a 13 Megapixel primary camera with 4128 x 3096 pixels, optical image stabilization, autofocus, dual-LED (dual tone) flash and an 8 Megapixel secondary camera which also has flash. There’s the Professional Mode, which for the first time, gives a smartphone camera that is capable of providing a professional photography experience. You can now control aspects like shutter speed, exposure, and light saturation to give your pictures a very professional and distinctive look. There’s the sapphire camera lens that is extremely scratch resistant and lets in more light to enhance camera performance. 
Blessed with real-time black and white filter, you can easily create iconic images with the following three settings: Mountain Road, Neutral Density Gray and Black and White. Even for selfies, other than having an 8 Megapixel camera, there’s also a pre-positioned soft light and a brand-new skin beautifying algorithm that gives you the power to create the best selfie photo possible. 
Surely you need lots of storage space to save all the photos right? This is where you can choose to go with either 32GB, 64GB or 128GB. If still not enough, you can then expand it further with a microSD slot up to a maximum of 128GB – at the expense of the 2 nd sim slot. 
The only concern could be on the rather smallish battery size with the Mate S only having a non-removable 2700 mAh battery to supply the necessary juice. It has everything to do with its thin size but still it has sufficient 
Other features that the Mate S has been Smart Recording where there are three microphones which help you to identify individual voices and sounds; that enables a clearer recording with minimal background noise. With Document Correction, there is no need to feel bothered any more when the document in the photo you just take is rotating. The Document Correction will adjust the angle of the document automatically and smartly on screen. Finally with Smart Wireless Printing, it lets you to just touch the documents on your screen and print them directly with compatible printers. 
Having dual sim capability and 4G LTE makes the Mate S complete. - Advertisement - 
Set to be released in the coming weeks, the stage is set for Huawei Mate S to make its presence known. New technology is the name of the game for this amazing phablet. Combine that with amazing hardware and you get the right recipe for a flagship with a difference. 
The Huawei Mate S will be available very soon although the price has yet to be revealed, but do expect it to cost a lot. It will be available in Luxurious Gold, Mystic Champagne, and Titanium Grey. News From
